result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy I Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Timothy I Johnson was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Timothy I Johnson is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Timothy I Johnson was found guilty of Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Timothy I Johnson was found guilty of Felon Possess Firearm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Timothy I Johnson was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.
  • Timothy I Johnson was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.  Firearm warning given.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment OR attend school full-time, may be a combination of both to equal 40 hours per week.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Defendant Timothy I Johnson in court with attorney Laura Ann Walker.  Defendant Timothy I Johnson in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.    Transcript filed: 11-16-15 ds.
Parties are in receipt of PSI and have reviewed same. No corrections noted by the parties but there are additions. Corrections put on the record by the defense. The State recommends a fairly substantial sentence on one of the counts is appropriate; Ct 2: 7 yrs WPS bifurcated as 4 yrs IC, 3 yrs ES; Ct 5: 5 yrs WPS bifurcated as 4 yrs IC, 1 yr ES-consec to Ct 2; remainder counts I/S probation and probation.

BTC: Ct 1: Sent w/held - 2 yrs probation, conc with Ct 6, consec to any other time being served
         Ct 2: Total sentence is 6 yrs WPS bifurcated as 3 yrs IC, 3 yrs ES-consec to time being served
         Ct 5: Total sentence is 3 yrs WPS bifurcated as 1 yr IC, 2 yrs ES-consec to Ct 2 and any other time being served
         Ct 6: sent w/held - 2 yrs probation, conc with Ct 1, consec to any other time being served

Conditions:
obey all rules and regs
costs
DNA sample is to be taken unless previously provided, costs
no alc/cs except by Rx-UA's

FT emp/school = FT

juror question
Cts 1-6
Sentencing hearing at 11-05-2015 01:30 pm

Defendant Timothy I Johnson in court with attorney Nathan Michael Jurowski.  Defendant Timothy I Johnson in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Deft withes to invoke his 5th amendment right not to answer the last question of the State. Parties give argument and the State asks that deft's testimony be stricken in its entirety. BTC: Deft has not waived his 5th amendment right and he may avail himself to his 5th amendment right regarding to the question at the center of discussion which prohibits the State from expoloring sale of THC to other persons. No concession to 4/15 date. 
Defense puts on the record the deft's desire to invoke his 5th amendment rights to the dates of  3/18, 3/27. The State does not wish to grant deft immunity regarding testimony on those dates. BTC: the deft may invoke his 5th amendment rights regarding testimony regarding dates of 3/18 & 3/27.
State resumes cross xam of deft. State marks Ex #66-70; photos. State moves #70 into evidence/no obj-received and published to the jury. State marks Ex #71-screenshot of door. State moves ex #67 & 71 into evidence/no obj-received and published. Redirect by defense. Defense rests. State has rebuttal. State recalls Inv. Kupper - DSAT. Direct by the State. State marks Ex #72-cell download DVD for Ex #63. State recalls Inv. Warren Jepson - DSAT. Direct by the State. Defense wishes to mark a photo as evidence and the State objects as it is not in the scope of rebuttal. No other witnesses. The State moves all exhibits not previously received into evidence/no obj - received. The State again rests.  Jury is excused to allow for JI to be completed. Defense moves to dimiss Cts 2, 3 & 4 as well as motion for directed verdict on those counts. BTC: motion of the defense is denied. State objects to verdict forms submitted by the defense as they are not correct. The Court will utilize the verdict forms as submitted by the State.
Ms. Riek gives closing arguments for the State. Mr. Jurowski gives closing arguments for defense. Rebuttal by State. The Court gives jury instruction. Alternate chosen, Oath #4 given. Jury begins deliberation at 12:35 pm
Reconvene for jury question-1:13 pm. The jury asks to see receipt for firearm and photos of BR. The court sends back ex #62 & 46 with note that no photos of just BR exist - only specific items IN the BR.
The jury has reached their verdict at 3:35 pm. 

Ct 1: GUILTY
Ct 2: GUILTY
Ct 3: NOT GUILTY
Ct 4: NOT GUILTY
Ct 5: GUILTY
Ct 6: GUILTY

The State moves for judgments on the verdict. 

BTC: Judgement granted. PSI ordered

Defendant Timothy I Johnson in court with attorney Nathan Michael Jurowski.  Defendant Timothy I Johnson in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.  Transcript filed: 09-29-2015 partial transcript of proceedings volume II. VW.
Jury enters, Oath #2 given. The Court gives preliminary instructions. Opening statements by the State. Opening statements by defense. State calls DP - DSAT. Direct by the State. State marks Ex #1-4; photos, Ex #5 video, Ex #6-Photo. Ex #7-10; photos, Ex #11-video. Cross xam by defense. State calls Inv. Kevin Kupper - DSAT. Direct by the State. State marks Ex #12-THC, #13-packaging & THC, #14-Photo of handgun; #15-handgun. #16-19-photos. Cross xam by defense. State calls Inv. Hans Freidel - DSAT. Direct by the State. No cross by defense. State calls Inv. Joe Villalobos - DSAT - Direct by the State. Cross by defense. State calls Officer Dennis Cecchini - DSAT. Direct by the State. Cross xam by defense. States calls Officer Bryant Petersen - DSAT. Direct by the State. State marks Ex #20-Photo, #32-Firearm case, #23-25-photo of surveillance camera, #26-photo purse, #27-Photo-Ammunition, #28-22 caliber ammunition, #29-Photo-ammunition, #30-ammunition, #31-photo-ammunition box, #32-bullets, #33-Firearm & magazine. Cross by defense. Redirect, state marks Ex #34-hand drawn layout of apt. State calls Officer Nicholas Contreras - DSAT. DIrect by the State. State marks Ex #35-41: photos. #42-firearm. #43-holster, #44-electronic device, #45-mail addressed to deft. Cross xam by defense. State calls Inv. Robert Heckel - DSAT. State marks Ex #46-48-Photos, #49-box of ammo/receipt, #50-receipt Direct by the State. Cross xam by defense. State calls Det. Daniel Langendorf - DSAT. Direct by the State. State markes Ex #51-gray Samsung cell phone. Cross xam by defense. State marks Ex #52-photo, #53-Smith & Wesson box. The Court conducts colloquy with deft regarding stipulation between parties outside the presence of the jury. State calls Inv. Warren Jepson - DSAT. Direct by the State. State marks Ex #55-scale, #56-mailed doc to Park Ave address, #57-box-Kahn gun. State recalls Inv. Kupper. State marks Ex #58 & 59-DVD's of cellphone downloads, #60-Stip, #61-photo. State moves for admission of all 60 exhibits. No objection/received. State rests.  Defense moves to dismiss Cts 2, 3 & 4. BTC: based on testimony of officers and evidence offered in court, a reasonable jury could find deft guilty. Motion to dismiss is denied. The Court conducts a colloquy with deft regarding his right to remain silent and right to testify. 
Defense calls SK - DSAT. Direct by the Defense. Defense marks Ex #62-bill of sale. Defense moves #62 into evidence/received. Cross xam by the State. Defense calls TJ - DSAT. Direct by the defense. Cross xam by the State.

Defendant Timothy I Johnson in court with attorney Nathan Michael Jurowski.  Defendant Timothy I Johnson in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Parties are prepared to proceed to trial. Final offer of the State is pl to Cts 2 and Cts 5 or 6. Balance DRI. This offer is not acceptable to the defendant and he rejects the offer.
The Court conducts colloquy regarding the stipulations of the parties. Jury enters at 2:13 pm. Oath #1 given. Ms. Riek introduces self and members of her office along with potential witnesses. Mr. Jurowski introduces self and his associates and potential witnesses. Voir dire by the Court. Voir dire by Ms. Riek for the State. Voir dire by Mr. Jurowski for the Defense. Parties exercise their peremptory challenges. The jury is chosen, no objection to the jury as chosen from either party.

Defendant Timothy I Johnson in court with attorney Nathan Michael Jurowski.  Defendant Timothy I Johnson in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Ms. Riek has not received the report /DVD that is possibly inculpatory to deft. The State will email Inv. Kupper and ask that it be provided no later than tomorrow. The State would like the fingerprint testing done and as of today's date the State has no received a response from Inv. Jepson as to if weapons can be tested for fingerprints. State's MIL are granted.
Anticipated length of trial is 2 days, 1 alternate, 5 strikes.The Court will give the following instructions: 50, 103, 148, 55, 58, 300, 140, 101

BTC: If RPD cannot give an answer by Wednesday, the Court is inclined to adj the trial. Defense to file jury instructions to the Court and the State by the end of business today. 23 will be seated. There will be 1 alternate and parties will have 5 strikes each.  Both counsel is to cooperate with one another in the event that the fingerprinting cannot be done.

Defendant Timothy I Johnson in court with attorney Nathan Michael Jurowski.  Defendant Timothy I Johnson in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
State motions to amend the information. Defense does not object. The State files amended information today in court. Defense acknowledges receipt, waives reading; NG plea is entered. The next matter is a Miranda/Goodchild hearing. Defense indicates that they do not challenge the statements and therefore, the hearing is not necessary. Defense asked to have the gun tested for fingerprints. Since trial is 2 weeks away, the State has asked the Crime lab if the testing is possible and if it is, if it can be accomplished prior to trial. Ms. Riek is not available for this trial is her case in Br 5 goes forward for trial. 

BTC: The State may use those statements in their case in chief. Case remains scheduled as is for now
